sentence.Network_en: Andrew went to the morgue to view Wyrazik's body.
sentence.Network_cn: 安德鲁到太平间去查看怀拉兹克的尸体.

sentence.Network_en: I have often seen drowned men laid out at the morgue.
sentence.Network_cn: 我经常在验尸所见到陈放着淹死者的尸体.

sentence.Network_en: When I arrived, I saw a car from the morgue.
sentence.Network_cn: 当我到的时候, 我看到一个车子从停尸房出来.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 太字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 太平〖 peaceandtranquility〗 太平间〖 mortuary;morgue〗 太平门〖 exit〗.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from French, originally the name of a building in Paris where bodies were kept until identified

entry.tran: (医院的)陈尸所，停尸房，太平间
entry.def: A morgue is a building or a room in a hospital where dead bodies are kept before they are buried or cremated, or before they are identified or examined.

means.word_mean: 1. a building (or room) where dead bodies are kept before burial or cremation

auth_sentence.content: I'm from the morgue, the father said.

auth_sentence.content: This place was like a morgue for days afterwards.
